results.title: Scrutinising the role of simvastatin in a patient of Pachyonychia Congenita with KRT6A gene mutation.
results.text_hl: On genetic analysis, a heterozygous @GENE_KRT6A @GENE_3853 @@@KRT6A@@@ gene missense mutation (@VARIANT_c.1381G>A_KRT6A_human @VARIANT_tmVar:c|SUB|G|1381|A;HGVS:c.1381G>A;VariantGroup:0;CorrespondingGene:3853;RS#:267607468;CorrespondingSpecies:9606;CA#:217327 @@@c.1381G > A@@@, @VARIANT_c.1381G>A_KRT6A_human @VARIANT_tmVar:p|SUB|E|461|K;HGVS:p.E461K;VariantGroup:0;CorrespondingGene:3853;RS#:267607468;CorrespondingSpecies:9606;CA#:217327 @@@p.Glu461Lys@@@ in exon 7) was identified by next-generation sequencing technology, consistent with @DISEASE_Pachyonychia_Congenita @DISEASE_MESH:D053549 @@@pachyonychia congenita 6a@@@. Oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg was started once daily, and after 16 weeks of therapy, excellent improvement was noted in @<m>DISEASE_Keratoderma_Palmoplantar</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007645 @@@palmoplantar keratoderma@@@ and @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@plantar pain@@@.
